Demiliches are formed when a lich, through carelessness or by accident, loses its soul cage. As years pass, the lich's body crumbles to dust, leaving only the skull as the seat of its necromantic power. The lich enters a sort of torpor, its mind left wandering the planes in search of ever greater mysteries. The lich gradually loses the ability to cast spells and its magic items slowly subsume into its new form. Negative energy concentrates around the skull, causing some of its bones and teeth to petrify with power and turn into blight crystals. The resulting lich skull, embedded with arcane gemstones and suffused with palpably powerful magic, forms a creature called a demilich. Despite its near-constant state of inactivity, a demilich grows restless from time to time, especially when living creatures draw near. Only then does the demilich's hunger for life stir once more, causing it to lash out with terrifying bursts of power in attempts to consume vital energy. Unlike an ordinary lich, should the demilich's skull be destroyed, its bond to the world is permanently severed, although some theorize that even then it is not truly slain. Rather, some think that once the demilich is destroyed, its foul and tormented mind is finally free to wander the planes and find new ways to enact its will. For the short-lived common folk of the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1), this is good enough, though eons later a demilich may reappear in the region it once inhabited with a new—and even more insidious—agenda. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 39 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 37 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 [Demilich](/Monsters.aspx?ID=283) **Source** [Bestiary](/Sources.aspx?ID=2) pg. 222 **Perception** +19; darkvision, [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2), [Elven](/Languages.aspx?ID=4), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20), [Undercommon](/Languages.aspx?ID=11) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +25, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +32, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +26, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +30, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +21, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +25 **Str** -3 **Dex** +4 **Con** +0 **Int** +7 **Wis** -2 **Cha** +5 **Torpor** Typically, a demilich is inert when encountered and doesn’t take actions until its [_contingency_](/Spells.aspx?ID=49) reaction has been triggered (see below). **Items** [Demilich Eye Gem](/Equipment.aspx?ID=489) (2) --- **AC** 38 **Fort** +23 **Ref** +27 **Will** +23 +1 status to all saves vs. positive **HP** 220 ([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Immunities** disease, paralyzed, poison, polymorph, unconscious **Resistances** cold 5, electricity 5, fire 5, physical 5 (except bludgeoning) **Telekinetic Whirlwind** ([arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65)) 20 feet. Telekinetic whirlwind activates when the demilich ends torpor. Loose debris in the area whip up into a whirling storm. This obscures vision, making any creature in the area concealed, and causes creatures in its area (except the demilich) to treat all creatures as concealed. Any creature other than the demilich that enters or begins its turn in the aura takes 2d12 bludgeoning damage.
**Contingency** A demilich has one permanent 8th-level [_contingency_](/Spells.aspx?ID=49) spell in effect with one of its arcane innate spells of 5th level or lower as the companion spell— typically [_dimension door_](/Spells.aspx?ID=69). **Trigger** While the lich is in torpor, a creature disturbs the demilich’s remains, touches its treasure, or casts a spell that would affect the demilich. **Effect** The demilich ends torpor, rolls initiative, and gains the effect of its [_contingency’s_](/Spells.aspx?ID=49) companion spell. The [_contingency_](/Spells.aspx?ID=49) resets after 24 hours.
**Countermeasures** **Trigger** The demilich’s turn begins. **Effect** The demilich casts [_blink_](/Spells.aspx?ID=27), [_fly_](/Spells.aspx?ID=125), [_spell turning_](/Spells.aspx?ID=297), or [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) on itself. It usually chooses spell turning unless it already has that spell in effect. --- **Speed** fly 30 feet **Melee** jaws +27 ([reach 0 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103)), **Damage** 1d4-3 piercing plus 6d6 negative **Arcane Innate Spells** DC 40, attack +30 - **Cantrips (8th)** [Mage Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=177), [Telekinetic Projectile](/Spells.aspx?ID=334) - **4th** [Blink](/Spells.aspx?ID=27) (at will), [Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) (at will), [Telekinetic Maneuver](/Spells.aspx?ID=333) (at will) - **7th** [Spell Turning](/Spells.aspx?ID=297) (at will) - **9th** [Wail of the Banshee](/Spells.aspx?ID=361) - **Constant (6th)** [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) **Demilich Eye Gems** ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11)) A demilich has gemstone eyes that glow when the demilich is active. Each eye contains an 8th-level spell that targets one creature (usually one eye has [_maze_](/Spells.aspx?ID=187) and the other [_polar ray_](/Spells.aspx?ID=224)). The demilich can Activate an eye. This uses the number of spellcasting actions the spell requires, and also requires command and envision components. When the demilich casts a spell from a gemstone eye, that eye stops glowing for 1d4 rounds, during which time that eye’s spell can’t be used. Occasionally, one or both of the two _demilich eye gems_ can be harvested from a destroyed demilich as [magic items](/Equipment.aspx?ID=489). **Devour Soul** ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [Negative](/Traits.aspx?ID=118)) **Requirements** A soul has been trapped in one of the demilich’s blight quartz gems (see Trap Soul) for 24 hours. **Effect** The demilich consumes the soul. The soul is utterly destroyed, and the demilich regains HP equal to double the creature’s level. **Mental Magic** A demilich can replace all material and somatic components for casting spells with verbal components, and can replace all Interact components for activating magic items with envision components. **Staff Gems** A demilich long ago absorbed the spells from a staff into gemstone nodules embedded in its skull, with larger nodules representing higher-level spells. It can cast any of the spells as though it were Activating the staff, and regains 1 charge per 4 hours spent in torpor, to a maximum of 8 charges. A typical demilich has the spells from a [_greater staff of necromancy_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=360), but it could have spells from another staff of 8th level or lower instead. **Trap Soul** command **Frequency** once per day per gem; **Effect** Ten blight quartz gemstones on the demilich’s skull can trap the souls of the living. The Activated gem casts [_bind soul_](/Spells.aspx?ID=21). This [_bind soul_](/Spells.aspx?ID=21) can target and affect a dying creature instead of a corpse. The dying creature can attempt a DC 38 Fortitude save; if it succeeds, it doesn’t die and its soul is not trapped but it’s enervated 2 (or is unaffected entirely on a critical success). When the soul of a creature gets trapped, the creature’s body swiftly turns to dust.
The gemstones work like the black sapphires used in [_bind soul_](/Spells.aspx?ID=21), except that they can hold creatures of up to 17th level and have a value of 200 gp apiece. The demilich can Devour a Soul it has trapped.
